name: Select Repeat Instance
description: A quick EM that allows you to keep a single instance of a repeating form in a non-repeating event for ease of reporting and branching-logic comparisons

project-settings.name:
Select Repeat Instance Instructions

This EM helps keep a single instance that represents the 'latest' or 'greatest' version of a repeating form

sub_settings.name:
Source Event Id
This is where the repeating data is located. It must contain the repeating instrument

Source Form
This is the repeating form you want to summarize

Logic
Each time a save occurs in the source event this logic will be evaluated to determine if the recently saved data should override the singleton, destination instance. Leave blank to ALWAYS update the destination instance. The logic will be executed in the context of the current event and instance of the source data that was just saved.
Destination Event Id This is a different event in the project where the singleton data will be saved.

Destination Summary Field (optional)
If specified, this field must be enabled in the destination event (on a form other than the Source Form). When the destination is updated, the instance id of the source form will be written to this field

project-settings.name:
Enable Debug Logging
(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger

system-settings.name: Enable Debug Logging (system-wide)(optional) Requires installation and configuration of emLogger
